Description: Georgetown College is a school in Georgetown.
Full Description:
In addition to being a Christian school dedicated to spiritual and
academic development, Georgetown College in Georgetown, Kentucky, has the
distinction of producing scholars and a high number of graduate students.
Georgetown’s academics consist of more than 70 majors and minors and
graduate programs in Education. Undergraduate programs of study include:
 * Art
 * Classics
 * Engineering
 * Psychology
 * Religious Studies
 * Theatre
Students in all programs get to examine such Christian ideals as morals,
faith and service while engaging in intensive studies.
Georgetown also has a highly innovative Spanish-language immersion
program, one of the few of its kind in the country.
College life at Georgetown includes academic, fine art, literary and
special interest clubs. Georgetown also has its own student-run radio
station.
The extensive financial aid options available at Georgetown make getting
a quality education possible to students from all economic backgrounds.
Need-based sources include grants, loans and work-study.
There is also a wide range of scholarships for eligible students. Some
are based on academic merit, and have such requirements as a minimum
grade point average of 3.75, while others are awarded based on talent.
Still others are given to those pursuing a specific major. Georgetown
also awards veteran’s benefits.
Applicants must possess a high school diploma or GED, an overall average
of at least a B and be in the top half of their graduating class. ACT or
SAT scores are also evaluated.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Management, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Mount Mary College is a school in Milwaukee.
Full Description:
Located in the beautiful city of Milwaukee, Wisconsin, Mount Mary College
is a private institution offering a superb education to its students.
Bachelor’s degrees are offered in almost every traditional concentration,
including less traditional studies such as Fashion Design, Theology,
Pre-Law, and Interior Design.
Students seeking a graduate degree can do so in Art Therapy, Business,
Counseling, Dietetics, Education, and Occupational Therapy.
Certificate programs are offered in a wide range of traditional fields,
and Teaching Credentials can also be earned at Mount Mary College.
Students are encouraged to participate in the many student life and
academic programs Mount Mary College has to offer. Students can enjoy
study-abroad opportunities, internships, the honors program, service
learning, and much more.
Students participate in student organizations, athletic clubs, intramural
sports, recreational activities, student government, honors societies,
and residential life.
Student support programs allow students to prioritize their education
without stressing about the small stuff. Students can take advantage of
academic tutoring, counseling, a health clinic, career services,
financial aid advising, academic counseling, and so much more.
Mount Mary College is committed to providing a well-rounded education in
a supportive environment.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Information Technology, Management, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Arkansas State University is a public research university located in Jonesboro, Arkansas
Full Description:
At Arkansas State University–Beebe (ASU-Beebe), you can take part in its vibrant student life while exploring a diverse host of educational programs. ASU-Beebe offers an affordable yet high-quality education that covers vast and comprehensive areas of study. 
Certificates and associate’s degrees are available in a variety of fields including liberal arts, business, education, skilled trades, veterinary medicine, and health & medical services.
As the parent campus to multiple branches in Seary, Herber Springs, and Little Rock Air Force Base, Arkansas State University-Beebe is the only two-year college in Arkansas with men’s and women’s housing. This progressive community college serves local communities throughout Arkansas by emphasizing technical training and certificate programs for the state’s workforce development. 
ASU-Beebe features include:
• “Open-Door” enrollment policy
• Adult Education (GED) centers
• Financial aid and scholarship programs for eligible students
• Active student life
• University credit transfer programs
• Student housing and meal plans
• Full-service Counseling Center
• Distance Learning for your convenience
ASU-Beebe contributes to Arkansas’s economic development by providing comprehensive training and technical support for business and industry. Whether you’re a traditional or non-traditional student seeking to advance your education or career, sign up for classes at ASU-Beebe today!
Industry Groups: Content and Publishing, Education, Media and Entertainment, Software

Description: Massachusetts Maritime Academy is a school in Buzzards Bay.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
Students looking to enter the maritime, engineering, emergency management
and environmental fields should look into the Massachusetts Maritime
Academy in Buzzards Bay, Massachusetts—the second oldest maritime academy
in the nation.
Unique to the school is its “sea term,” a program conducted in January
and February. This program gives aspiring cadets the opportunity to apply
their education and training as they sail to ports along the Caribbean
Sea. During the approximately 52-day voyage, students will also gain
real-world experience in seafaring and ship operations like deck and
engine watches, and learn how to properly maintain a vessel.
Academics offered at the school include more than five bachelor’s
degrees, including Emergency Management, Maritime Engineering, Marine
Transportation and more. Two graduate degrees are available in Emergency
Management and Facilities Management.
The school also offers professional and continuing education courses.
In addition to an application, admissions require students to submit
official high school transcripts, two letters of recommendation, ACT/SAT
test scores and proof of citizenship.
Tuition is set lower for Massachusetts residents.
Financial aid is determined for students on an individual basis. Students
who complete a FAFSA will be considered for financial aid through the
form of federal and state grants, loans and institutional scholarships.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Clackamas Community College is a school in Oregon City.
Full Description:
Clackamas Community College (CCC) offers various associate’s degrees,
including transfer degrees, so that it can effectively help students
looking to earn a two-year degree and start their new career. The school
also aims to help students looking to earn their two-year degree and then
transfer to a four-year university for a bachelor’s degree.
In fact, students interested in a four-year degree can take advantage of
Clackamas Community College’s degree partnership program with a few of
Oregon’s Universities.
The Oregon City campus is the main campus for CCC, and home to the
Environmental Learning Center and Community Gardens, among many other
attractions.
CCC has an easy admissions process: complete an application, take your
placement tests (or submit your SAT/ACT scores for evaluation), and
attend an advising session to determine your study plan.
Due to its proud focus and commitment to serving our nations veterans,
Clackamas Community College was named a 2010 military-friendly school by
G.I. Jobs Magazine and is approved as a veterans training institute by
the Veterans Administration.
In-state and regionally located students receive a significant discount
on tuition. As an accredited community college, CCC is able to offer
financial aid to help ease the cost of college life for eligible
students. Submitting a FAFSA is the first step to determining eligibility
for financial aid.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Medical & Science, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Arkansas State University, Mountain Home is a school in Mountain Home.
Full Description:
Arkansas State University Mountain Home offers traditional career and
educational programs as well as those intended for individuals from
challenged backgrounds.
The Mountain Home campus of Arkansas State offers associate’s degrees and
career certificates in preparation for careers in Business, Dental
Hygiene, Funeral Science, Nursing, Respiratory Care and Welding, among
others. A General Studies degree is also awarded for those who wish to
transfer to a four-year university.
Mountain Home’s programs are intended to accommodate students from all
economic and social backgrounds. Newport’s Career Pathways fulfills this
commitment by providing comprehensive educational and career training for
low-income parents. Students in this program have access to childcare,
tuition assistance, tutoring and other services.
Newport also has adult education programs, which help students to learn
basic math skills, English skills and/or prepare for the GED.
All Newport students have access to career services and academic support

Alcorn State University is a school in Lorman.
Full Description:
For a high quality, flexible educational experience at a small, private
school with a large community, the Alcorn State University in Lorman,
Mississippi, may be the place for you.
Student life at Alcorn is active with more than 40 campus clubs and
organizations. The community is inclusive and strives to nurture an
academic environment that supports diversity through exposure,
sensitivity and understanding of a wide range of educational and
leadership opportunities.
Academics offered at the university include a variety of degrees,
including associate’s, bachelor’s, master’s and specialist degrees in the
university’s seven schools. Programs are offered in fields like the
liberal arts and sciences, agriculture and applied sciences, business,
education, psychology and more.
Admissions are determined on a rolling basis, allowing you to start
whenever you’re accepted. There are four criteria for acceptance:
 * High school GPA of at least 3.2
 * High school GPA of at least 2.5 and an ACT score of 16
 * High school GPA of at least 2.0 and an ACT score of 18
 * Satisfy the NCAA standards for student-athletes who are “full
 qualifiers”
The school is both drug and smoke free.
Tuition is set lower for Mississippi residents.
Students who complete a FAFSA application may be eligible to receive
financial aid through the form of federal, state and private assistance.
Alcorn State University is an HBCU

Description: Lamar Institute of Technology is a school in Beaumont.
Full Description:
Interested in a vocational training opportunity to start a new career?
Perhaps you’re interested in earning some college credits in order to
transfer to a four-year university? Located in Beaumont, Texas, Lamar
Institute of Technology can provide an avenue for either candidate.
Academic programs at Lamar range from vocational training certificates
and associate’s degrees to college-track credits. Students participating
in the vocational training courses are exposed to hands-on training and
comprehensive preparatory courses to tackle the job market upon
graduation. Students can choose between several concentrations that
represent the needs of the local economy. Allied Health, Police Academy,
and various technology related fields are represented among the many
vocational programs.
An associate’s in General Education is encouraged for students wishing to
transfer to a four-year university. Because Lamar is part of the Texas
State University system, credits are easily transferred to other public
institutions in the system.
Distance learning options provide an accessible higher education route
for busy adults. High school seniors have the option to participate in
dual enrollment programs in order to start their college career early.
Continuing education courses are offered to community members who wish to
enhance vocational skills or even simple skills, such as basic computer
knowledge or English as a Second Language (ESL).
Student support programs are offered to help students achieve their
goals. Academic workshops and tutoring are offered to help struggling
students, and career and academic advising help keep students on track to
graduate and prepare for the job search.
Lamar is more than just an institution of higher learning. It also
provides the foundation to promote a better life.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Saint Joseph Seminary College is a school in Saint Benedict.
Full Description:
Saint Joseph Seminary College offers studies in preparation for the
priesthood and deaconry as well as degree programs for individuals
interested in theological studies or the lay ministry.
Located in Saint Benedict, Louisiana, Saint Joseph’s idyllic, rural
setting is ideal for those pursuing a spiritual lifestyle and education.
Since the spiritual component is the most important one, students engage
in regular prayer, Bible study, worship, spiritual mentoring and other
spiritual and religious activities.
Since Saint Joseph Seminary College also promotes intellectual growth
students also undertake intensive academic study in the liberal arts,
including such subjects as Latin and philosophy. In addition to its
priesthood and deacon preparation programs, Saint Joseph offers degrees
in Theology, Philosophy and Religious Studies.
Recreational facilities and arts activities allow students to relax and
nurture themselves creatively and physically as well.
A commitment to the priestly life is, of course, a requirement for
admission to the seminary program. Those interested in Saint Joseph’s
academic programs may contact a school representative about admissions
requirements, as well as financial aid opportunities.

Description: Craven Community College is a school in New Bern.
Full Description:
Craven Community College offers transfer opportunities, career training,
continuing education and enrichment options to residents of the New Bern,
North Carolina region.
At Craven one may obtain an associate’s degree, certificate or diploma
leading to in-demand careers in health or medicine, criminal justice,
cosmetology and business administration.
At Craven students may also receive highly specialized and
technologically advanced training in aeronautical technology and
industrial fields.
Since Craven maintains partnerships with such four-year schools as East
Carolina University, North Carolina State and Southern Illinois
University, those who plan to transfer also have a number of exciting

The continuing education division serves approximately 10,000 students

Student life at Craven includes a number of student clubs and

expanding and growing academically, professionally, creatively and

Craven has an open admissions policy and students may apply online or

Description: Interdenominational Theological Center is a school in Atlanta.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Atlanta Area, East Coast, Southern US
Full Description:
The Interdenominational Theological Center in Atlanta, Georgia, is
faith-related, graduate-level institution dedicated to producing public
theologians, and men and women committed to aiding disadvantaged African
American communities. Interdenominational Theological Center is an HBCU. 
True to its interdenominational moniker, the center has seminaries
dedicated to each of its six denominations, including:
 * United Methodist
 * Baptist
 * African Methodist Episcopal
 * Christian Methodist Episcopal
 * Presbyterian Church
 * Church of God in Christ
Students can benefit from a well-rounded college life, as the ITC’s
Student Christian League coordinates many opportunities for personal and
spiritual development. Events like late-night ecumenical services,
leadership and motivation workshops, community outreach opportunities and
special chapel events ensure that every student has the ability to get
involved.
The academics offered at ITC include these degree programs:
 * Master of Divinity
 * Master of Arts in Christian Education
 * Master of Arts in Church Music
 * Doctor of Ministry
 * Doctor of Theology in Pastoral Counseling
You can also participate in extracurricular programs like Black Women in
Church and Society, Religious Heritage of the African World and Faith and
Health Leadership to complement your classroom studies.
Students who demonstrate the need for tuition assistance will be
considered for ITC financial aid programs through grants and
scholarships.
If you’re interested in transforming your life, and the lives of others,
you can apply online via the Interdenominational Theological Center’s
admissions website.

Description: IYRS EMPOWERS STUDENTS TO MAKE, BUILD, RESTORE & MAINTAIN ALMOST ANYTHING.
Full Description: Building with our hands is the essence of creativity, productivity, human spirit, and even community—as our knowledge, passion and our creations are passed along through generations. As humans, we are driven to do this kind of activity, and to celebrate the associated art and knowledge, that ability to think through our hands. Enter IYRS, a school founded initially to reinvigorate and teach these skills in the world of boat craft and restoration. Along the way, those traditional and cutting edge skills, and the hands-on way IYRS teaches them, have helped IYRS develop a whole new experiential education model—a model that prepares deeply technical and ultra-talented craftspeople and technicians to work with a range of materials, and to maintain a range of mechanical systems, to help industry and the individual. That educational model is this: students immersed both body and spirit, with a team equally dedicated, in a condensed timeframe, to transform materials and systems into useful, lasting things, and in so doing transforming their own lives and careers. When we build with our hands, immersed with others in the task, we become attuned to the importance of all that we do. At IYRS, students learn to make, restore and maintain things with this heightened sense of purpose and craft, becoming truly in demand across industries. In the process, they build more meaningful lives, satisfied and inspired in the knowledge that, in their hands, they have the power to build almost anything.
Top Five Investors: Hagerty Education Program, van Beuren Charitable Foundation
Contact Job Departments: Finance, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Stephen F Austin State University is a school in Nacogdoches.
Full Description:
All-American social and athletic traditions, in combination with solid academics, are the defining features of Stephen F. Austin State University. 
Located in Nacogdoches, Texas, Stephen F. Austin is a public, independent university that offers more than 120 areas of academic study, about half of which are master’s and doctoral programs. 
Stephen F. Austin’s academic offerings include such fields as Radio-Television Broadcasting, Agriculture, Forestry, programs in the arts and humanities and teacher-education programs. 
Active, fun sororities and fraternities are part of what distinguishes the social life at Stephen F. Austin. 
On a typical weekend or evening at Stephen F. Austin students adorn the grasses of the football stadium, holding up signs from their respective “Greek” houses and cheering on the football team. 
The sports teams at Stephen F. Austin are also a strong and important influence. An FCS team in the NCAA, the Stephen F. Austin football team has won conference championships and recently earned a playoff berth. 
The lively social life at Stephen F. Austin can also be seen in the various student activities. In addition to active on-campus living and a number of clubs there is also a student activities association. Through this association, students plan and participate in campus events. 
Student services at Stephen F. Austin include career, academic and personal counseling, a health center, and support for disabled students. 
Financial aid at Stephen F. Austin includes loans, work-study, grants and scholarships for those who qualify/

Description: Undergraduate baccalaureate, non-profit, co-educational institution
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
At Becker College, you will be part of a close-knit community that values excellence, social responsibility, integrity and creative expression. Becker College will allow you to learn in a positive environment, and prepare you for a great career of your choice in the process.
The college offers 27 undergraduate degree programs including a nursing program, in its 30th year, which is one of the top 20 producers of registered nurses in Massachusetts, a veterinary sciences program which is among the top-15 producers nationally among four-year private institutions in awarding undergraduate animal studies degrees in 2011-2012, and a video game design and development program ranked in the top 20 nationally for the past five years by The Princeton Review. In April 2011, the Commonwealth of Massachusetts designated Becker as the home of the Massachusetts Digital Games Institute (MassDiGI). The college’s enrollment has grown to 1,902, and students have the opportunity to live and study in the urban atmosphere of Worcester or the rural environment of Leicester. Becker College has over 21,000 alumni.[5]. 
Becker admissions will take into consideration the student as a whole, weighing equally all application materials such as information on high school grades and ranking, standardized test scores and suggested recommendations. You can submit an application right on the website.
Students who may need assistance with the costs of tuition can count on a financial aid program that will cater to their requirements. These might include grants, loans or scholarships. To check their qualification students should begin by submitting the FAFSA soon after acceptance. Tuition varies by program and housing arrangement.
Becker also offers a great college life for its students. On-campus activities are always available, like trivia nights, talent shows, and movie screenings. Many clubs and organizations are available to join, as well, and athletic groups are always looking for great players to add to their team!

Description: Mid-America Christian University is a school in Oklahoma City.
Full Description:
Mid-America Christian University (MACU) offers students a higher
education in a close-knit, Christian environment.
The MACU campus is located in Oklahoma City, just minutes from downtown,
where opportunities abound. Students are right in the heart of a
metropolitan city that is full of activities, events and recreation.
MACU has undergraduate and graduate degrees programs in fields that
include: Behavioral Science, Business Administration, Music Performance,
Specialized Ministries, and Teacher Education.
It also has accelerated learning programs with flexible scheduling
options for working adults. Some of the programs designed for working
adults are: Christian Ministry, Communication and Public Relations, and
Health Care Administration and Ethics.
To enroll at MACU, students must submit an admissions application and
fee, personal references, official transcripts, and standardized test
scores. A minimum score of 18 on the ACT, or a minimum score of 750 on
the SAT, is required for acceptance.
The school’s tuition fees can be brought down with financial aid. Various
forms of financial aid are available to those who qualify: grants, loans,
scholarships, and work study programs. MACU gives out many athletic
scholarships to eligible athletes as well.
If you want to experience college life at a small Christian school in
Oklahoma, consider Mid-America Christian University.

Description: The Black Hole Initiative is an interdisciplinary center at Harvard University.
Full Description:
The Black Hole Initiative (BHI) is an interdisciplinary center at Harvard University involving a collaboration between Principal Investigators (PIs) from the fields of Astronomy (Sheperd Doeleman, Avi Loeb and Ramesh Narayan), Physics (Andrew Strominger), Mathematics (Shing-Tung Yau) and Philosophy (Peter Galison).
The BHI is the first worldwide center to focus on the study of black holes, and as such it offers a unique naming opportunity for potential donors.

Description: School of Advertising Art Inc is a school in Dayton.
Full Description:
The School of Advertising Art (SAA) in Kettering, Ohio, offers a
comprehensive two-year degree program for aspiring advertising
professionals. SAA students also get professional work experience and the
majority of graduates get full-time work shortly after graduating.
In their first year, all SAA students take the same classes, which
include:
 * Art History
 * Copywriting
 * Marketing
 * Professional Presentation
In the second year, SAA assigns students to an externship at an
advertising agency, graphic design firm or other advertising business.
SAA’s career services division also helps students to find full-time work
upon graduating.
SAA also has transfer agreements with such four-year schools as:
 * Columbus College of Art & Design
 * Art Institute of Atlanta
 * Art Institute of California
 * Antioch University
Those seeking admission will need to submit an application, a high school
transcript or GED, a personal essay and letters of recommendation. While
SAT scores are not required for admissions, applicants may submit them.
An interview with an admissions officer is also required.
SAA offers several tuition awards and scholarships to first-year
students. Criteria used for scholarships and awards include academic
performance, talent and ethnic background. SAA also awards need-based
grants and loans. To apply for grants and loans, students must submit a
FAFSA.

Description: Oxford is a world-leading centre of learning, teaching and research and the oldest university in the English-speaking world.
Full Description:
Oxford is a collegiate university, consisting of the central University and colleges. The central University is composed of academic departments and research centres, administrative departments, libraries and museums. The 38 colleges are self-governing and financially independent institutions, which are related to the central University in a federal system. There are also six permanent private halls, which were founded by different Christian denominations and which still retain their Christian character.
The collegiate system is at the heart of the University’s success, giving students and academics the benefits of belonging both to a large, internationally renowned institution and to a small, interdisciplinary academic community. It brings together leading academics and students across subjects and year groups and from different cultures and countries, helping to foster the intense interdisciplinary approach that inspires much of the outstanding research, <a href="https://www.dissertationcorp.co.uk/">dissertation help</a> achievement of the University and makes Oxford a leader in so many fields.

Full Description:
For those in Southern California who want to pursue a degree in a medical

Pre-physical therapy, pre-chiropractic, pre-veterinary and pre-pharmacy
tech are some of the pre-study academics offered at Cerritos College.
These programs allow you to start the process towards an advanced medical
degree without incurring the expense.
Each of these specific programs is organized to help you transfer to a
university program with ease. Each department provides a list of the
pre-study courses you will need to take at Cerritos before transferring.
They also provide links on their website to all of the universities that
offer your program.
In addition to these pre-study programs, Cerritos College offers a number
of other associate's degrees and certificates in business, computers,
arts and sciences, among others.
Cerritos College supports its students, regardless of their major, with
options to make college life simple, such as career services, tutoring,
learning resources, and transfer counseling.
Cerritos College financial aid is available to those who qualify for
tuition assistance based on need, academic merit and other factors.

Full Description:

professional and academic degrees as well as leading edge work
opportunities and even programs abroad.
At Coastline Community College you may earn a vocational degree in such
fields as :
 * Accounting
 * Computer Information Systems
 * Emergency Services
 * Paralegal Studies
Students in these and other fields are at a great advantage when
attending Coastline: they have the option of enrolling in the Work-Based
Learning program, which allows them to actually earn credit for daily,
relevant work experience.
Alternately, students at Coastline may elect to get an associate’s degree
in liberal arts or even fine arts, with which they can also take
advantage of Coastline’s Arts Abroad program in Florence, Italy.
Admission to Coastline is available to anyone who is at least 18 years
old, though those who are under 18 may also attend as long as they’ve

received permission from their principal and parent.
Tuition for California residents is reduced. Students who want financial
aid may fill out a FAFSA to be considered for loans, grants and/or a
work-study program. Military benefits are also available to those who
qualify.

Description: The Jenner Institute was founded in November 2005 to develop innovative vaccines against major global diseases.
Full Description:
The Jenner Institute was founded in November 2005 to develop innovative vaccines against major global diseases. Uniquely it focuses both on diseases of humans and livestock and tests new vaccine approaches in parallel in different species. A major theme is translational research involving the rapid early-stage development and assessment of new vaccines in clinical trials.
The Institute comprises the research activities of over 30 Jenner Investigators who head leading research groups spanning human and veterinary vaccine research and development. Together the Institute Investigators comprise one of the largest non-profit sector research and development activities in vaccinology.
Jenner Institute Investigators, through the support of many funders, are developing new vaccine candidates against major global infectious diseases. New vaccines against malaria, tuberculosis and HIV are currently in field trials in the developing world. Research is also underway on livestock vaccines against foot and mouth disease, avian influenza, bovine tuberculosis and other major causes of economic loss.

The University is organized into several colleges and schools, including the College of Engineering, College of Science, Nanyang Business School, Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences, and Graduate College. NTU is also home to several autonomous institutions such as Singapore's National Institute of Education, S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre on Environmental Life Sciences Engineering."

Description: Rose State College is a school in Oklahoma City.
Full Description:
Many of Oklahoma’s home-schooled students choose to attend Rose State College. This is for the same reason that many working adults, parents and high school students also choose Rose State: the school offers incredible flexibility of scheduling and classes. 
Located minutes from downtown Oklahoma City, Rose State College has five distinctive academic divisions: business and information technology, engineering, health sciences, humanities and social sciences. Its 60 programs lead directly to a career or prepare one to transfer to a four-year university. 
The distinguishing feature of a Rose State education is its innovative and flexible scheduling options. Not bound to the usual semester and quarter system, classes at Rose state are offered in two, four, eight or 16-week terms. Classes are also offered during the day and evening in the classroom, and at any time online. 
Another attribute of a Rose State College education is the campus culture. Rose State has a 1400-seat professional theatre where nationally-known artists often perform. Rose State also has over 35 clubs and organizations, a school newspaper and a number of athletic teams. 
Rose State’s student services include the Workforce Development Division, which provides professional training and career advisement. 
Financial aid is based on need and includes loans, work-study, grants and scholarship, or a combination of these to those who qualify.

Description: Southeast Kentucky Community and Technical College, Cumberland is a school in Cumberland.
Full Description:
The Cumberland location serves as Southeast Kentucky Community and

Despite being a commuter college, student life at Southeast offers a

SKCTC strives to make education affordable for everyone, and offers a

NEMCC is a public school that offers educational degree programs and

After graduation, NEMCC provides its students with job placement

Description: Established in 1837, the Royal College of Art is the world’s longest-running postgraduate college of art and design.
Full Description:
Established in 1837, the Royal College of Art is the world’s longest-running postgraduate college of art and design. Based around the six Schools of Architecture, Communication, Design, Fine Art, Humanities and Material, our breadth of subjects is wide and embodies a deep tradition of practice-based research. 
Students come to the RCA from across the globe and find themselves at the dynamic heart of one of the most exciting periods of cultural development in over a generation, born from the shifts in technology and craft, art and design, communication, science and social relevance. We actively encourage cross-disciplinary activity and experimentation, led by world-renowned practitioners, many of whom are drawn from our successful alumni. There are some 1,200 students at the College at any one time, taught by over 350 members of staff including a distinguished, revolving cast of visiting professors, lecturers and practitioners. 
The RCA has a strong research culture – there are over 120 MPhil and PhD students – that both leads and informs each School-wide knowledge base. Within each curriculum are opportunities for cross-pollination through group projects with other RCA programmes, and creative collaborations with key partners provide industry-specific experience that is mutually beneficial.
Many new developments are currently in progress at the College, including the completion of new buildings, workshops and studios; the creation of a new research hub; the expansion of joint projects with industry; the launch of four dynamic new courses; and the appointment of many new members of our academic teams. Our vision is to help develop great creative minds, and ideas that will be central to the cultural evolution of our societies.
Housed over two campuses in Kensington and Battersea, the RCA is surrounded by some of the most important spaces and events in London’s art and design worlds, and an exciting social scene of bars, clubs and cafés.
The twenty-first-century RCA knows that its graduates contribute significant, real-world innovations across art, communication, critical writing, exhibition-making and design – both as practitioners and through research. Future innovation doesn’t grow in isolation, and the RCA’s new Schools, each led by a Dean who is a leading practitioner in his or her field, promote hybridity and opportunities for interdisciplinarity.

Description: ETH Zurich is a Switzerland-based engineering, science, technology, mathematics, and management university.
Full Description:
ETH Zurich is an engineering, science, technology, mathematics, and management university. It is an integral part of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology Domain (ETH Domain) that is directly subordinate to Switzerland's Federal Department of Economic Affairs, Education, and Research.
ETH Zurich is consistently rated among the top universities in the world. It is considered the best university in continental Europe by the Shanghai Ranking ARWU, the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, and the QS World University Ranking. It is currently ranked 4th in Europe overall, and 8th best university in the world in engineering, science, and technology. Twenty-one Nobel Prizes have been awarded to students and professors of the institute in the past. The most famous of them is Albert Einstein in 1921 and the most recent is Richard F. Heck in 2010. It is a founding member of the IDEA League and the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU); and a member of the CESAER network.
ETH Zurich was founded by the Swiss Federal Government in 1854 with the stated mission to educate engineers and scientists, serve as a national center of excellence in science and technology, and provide a hub for interaction between the scientific community and industry.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Management, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Tow Center for Digital Journalism provides journalists with the skills to technologically change the field of digital journalism.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater New York Area, East Coast, Northeastern US
Full Description: The Tow Center for Digital Journalism provides journalists with the skills to technologically change the field of digital journalism. It also provides research and develops facilities for the profession as a whole. The Tow Center also oversees the new dual-degree Master of Science Program in Computer Science and Journalism offered in conjunction with Columbia’s Fu Foundation School of Engineering and Applied Science. Here, students will receive specialized training in the digital environment, enabling them to develop technical and editorial skills in all aspects of computer-supported news gathering and digital media production.The Tow Foundation supports innovative projects and collaborative ventures where there is a shortage of both public and private funding and opportunities for breakthroughs, reforms, and significant benefits to society. Tow Center for Digital Journalism was founded as a part of Columbia University in 2010 and is based in New York, USA.
Industry Groups: Content and Publishing, Media and Entertainment, Other

Description: North Park University is a school in Chicago.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Chicago Area, Great Lakes, Midwestern US
Full Description:
North Park University in Chicago, Illinois, is a liberal arts university
that is dedicated to Christian values, and that offers students the
opportunity to pursue a degree through unique learning experiences.
The university was founded by the Evangelical Covenant Church and
maintains its religious commitment by offering educational programs
through North Park Theological Seminary. Students who want to pursue
ministerial vocations or engage in urban ministry projects should check
out its programs.
North Park's academics are offered in a variety of liberal arts
disciplines, as well as religion-focused programs. Some concentrations
include:
 * Biblical and Theological Studies
 * Africana Studies
 * Clinical Laboratory Science
 * Global Studies
 * Mathematics
North Park's Campus Life Association and Student Senate (CLASS) is a
valuable resource if you are looking to gain leadership skills. You can
be appointed leader of a student club or work within the CLASS group to
develop your communication and team working skills.
The school offers many study abroad programs for students looking to gain
a global perspective during their college career.
To be considered for enrollment, applicants must submit a personal essay,
high school transcript, ACT/SAT scores and letters of recommendation.
Some students may be required to be complete a personal interview with a
North Park admissions advisor.
North Park offers eligible students who have filed a FAFSA financial aid
through grants, work-study programs, direct student loans and
scholarships.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Northampton Community College, Bethlehem is a school in Bethlehem.
Full Description:
New York residents looking for a preparatory education that will prepare
them for gainful employment or for higher education do not have to look
any further than the North Hampton Community College in Bethlehem, New
York.
North Hampton maintains an open-door admissions policy so that students
from varying educational backgrounds can be considered for enrollment, as
long as they have earned a high school diploma or GED.
The college understands that much of your maturation happens outside the
classroom, which is why it offers plenty of college life opportunities.
From its residential housing community to emerging leader seminars to a
variety of student clubs and organizations, you will be able to find the
friends and opportunities for personal, social and professional
development.
North Hampton offers academics in more than 100 areas of study. Students
have the option of pursuing certificates, diplomas or associate’s degrees
in many fields, some of which include:
 * Biotechnology
 * Journalism
 * Early Childhood Education
 * Small Business Management
 * Theatre
A variety of foundational scholarships are awarded to students who meet
need or merit qualifications. Other forms of financial aid North Hampton
is authorized to offer include federal grants, loans and work-study
programs.
Tuition costs vary by residency. Students from a sponsored Bethlehem
school district, Monroe County district or the state of Pennsylvania
receive discounted prices.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Brazosport College, Lake Jackson is a school in Lake Jackson.
Full Description:
In addition to a number of associate degree programs, Brazosport College is now offering a bachelor’s degree program that prepares students for a variety of career opportunities. 
Students at Brazosport, located in Lake Jackson, Texas, may undertake an associate’s degree in various disciplines, primarily in vocational areas such as carpentry, emergency medical services and nursing. 
There are also associate’s programs designed for transfer to a four-year school. Brazosport is going a step further in offering a bachelor’s degree program in Applied Technology for the same two-year college cost. This program prepares students for a variety of supervisory positions in such areas as human resources and technology. 
Brazosport’s bachelor’s program uses a hands-on approach to learning, enlisting its students in internship positions where they may incorporate and expand upon what they’ve learned. 
Counseling and advising on career, transfer and academic matters are part of what Brazosport offers all of its students. 
Financial aid options for eligible students include the SHINE scholarship, as well as other scholarships, work-study and student loans.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Animal Behavior College provides certifications in veterinary assisting, pet training, and pet grooming.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Los Angeles Area, West Coast, Western US
Full Description: Animal Behavior College is a pet industry school providing certifications in veterinary assisting, pet training, and pet grooming. Its structure incorporates distance-learning and hands-on externship training, providing students both extensive book learning and practical skills application. ABC offers programs for certified dog training, cat training, pet grooming, and veterinary assistants in all 50 states and every Canadian province, making it the largest vocational school of its kind in North America.

Description: Thomas College is a school in Waterville.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
Thomas College in Waterville, Maine, provides career-oriented education
in business, technology and education, quality undergraduate academics,
graduate degrees and continuing education courses.
The college is so confident in its graduating students that it offers the
Guaranteed Job Placement Program, which guarantees any students
graduating with a bachelor’s degree a job in their field of study within
six months.
If students aren’t placed, they have the option of returning to Thomas
College for two more years at no tuition cost. If you land a job and it’s
not in your field of study, you may also return to take an unlimited
number of undergraduate courses tuition-free for up to two years.
The school offers a wide variety of undergraduate degrees, in disciplines
like:
 * Accounting
 * Business and Management
 * Communication
 * Education
 * Finance
 * Psychology
 * Sports Management
Graduate degrees offered include:
 * Master’s of Business Administration
 * Master’s of Business Administration (Human Resources Concentration)
 * Master’s of Science in Education
 * Assistant Principal/Assistant Building Administrator Certificate
On-campus housing and meal plans are available, but not required, so
students may choose the style of college life that suits them.
Financial aid is available to those who qualify through the FAFSA, and
Thomas College also funds its own scholarships, which are awarded to
eligible students.
Admissions requirements vary depending on the level of study. Contact
Thomas College for more information.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services

Organization Name: West Virginia University School of Medicine
Description: West Virginia University School of Medicine is a school.
As one of the world’s leading and largest graduate business schools, INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas to change lives
Full Description:
As one of the world’s leading and largest graduate business schools, INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas to change lives and to transform organisations. A global perspective and cultural diversity are reflected in all aspects of our research and teaching.
With campuses in Europe (France), Asia (Singapore) and Abu Dhabi, INSEAD’s business education and research spans three continents. Our 146 renowned Faculty members from 34 countries inspire more than 1,300 degree participants annually in our MBA, Executive MBA, Specialised Master’s degrees (Master in Finance, Executive Master in Consulting and Coaching for Change) and PhD programmes. In addition, more than 12,000 executives participate in INSEAD’s Executive Education programmes each year.
In addition to INSEAD’s programmes on our three campuses, INSEAD participates in academic partnerships with the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania (Philadelphia & San Francisco); the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University near Chicago, and Johns Hopkins University/SAIS in Washington DC. In Asia, INSEAD partners with Tsinghua University in Beijing and with CEIBS. INSEAD is a founding member in the multidisciplinary Sorbonne University created in 2012, and also partners with Fundação Dom Cabral in Brazil.
INSEAD became a pioneer of international business education with the graduation of the first MBA class on the Fontainebleau campus in Europe in 1960. In 2000, INSEAD opened its Asia campus in Singapore. And in 2007 the school began an association in the Middle East, officially opening the Abu Dhabi campus in 2010.
Around the world and over the decades, INSEAD continues to conduct cutting edge research and to innovate across all our programmes to provide business leaders with the knowledge and sensitivity to operate anywhere. These core values have enabled us to become truly "The Business School for the World."
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services, Product, Sales

Organization Name: University of Maryland School of Nursing
Industries: Health Care, Higher Education, Medical, Universities
Description: University of Maryland School of Nursing has been a driving force,
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Baltimore-Maryland Area, East Coast, Southern US
Full Description: The University of Maryland School of Nursing, founded in 1889, is one of the oldest and largest nursing schools, and is ranked 11th nationally. Enrolling more than 1,700 students in its baccalaureate, master’s, and doctoral programs, the School develops leaders who shape the profession of nursing and impact the health care environment. The School of Nursing shares a 61-acre campus in downtown Baltimore with the University of Maryland (UM) six other professional schools—Dentistry, Law, Medicine, Pharmacy, Social Work, and the Graduate School—and is in close proximity to the University of Maryland Medical Center, University of Maryland Biotechnology Institute, University of Maryland BioPark, and the Baltimore VA Medical Center

Description: Southern University at New Orleans is a school in New Orleans.
Full Description:
Southern University at New Orleans (SUNO), located near Downtown New
Orleans, has provided students and career professionals with higher
education learning opportunities for over 50 years. Southern University at New Orleans is an HBCU. 
The public university has a partnership with Delgado Community College
(DCC) to allow students to complete their first two years at DCC, and
then their final two years at SUNO, if they want to take advantage of the
“2+2” bachelor’s degree program. Academic majors that qualify under the
program offering are: Biology, Criminal Justice, and Mathematics.
SUNO also has its own undergraduate and graduate degree programs in areas
such as:
 * Business Entrepreneurship
 * Early Childhood Education
 * Health Information Management Systems
 * Museum Studies
 * Public Administration
 * Substance Abuse Counseling
Admissions criteria to SUNO will consider completed coursework and GPA.
The school may require minimum ACT scores as well.
Residents of Louisiana are eligible for lower tuition rates, and
financial aid programs are available to those who need additional
assistance. Those who are interested in applying for financial aid are
encouraged to speak with a specialist on campus who can review their
options with them.
The school offers quite a selection of activities in which students can
take part. From Greek Life and sports to campus ministry and community
service, there are many chances for students to get engaged in college
life at SUNO.
Contact Job Departments: Finance, Human Resources, Management, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Georgia Southern University is the state’s largest and most comprehensive center of higher education south of Atlanta.
Full Description:
With over 100 academic concentrations and a continually growing
enrollment, Georgia Southern University prides itself on being one of the
premiere research institutions in Georgia. The school is the largest in
southern Georgia, and in 2006, the Carnegie Foundation for the
Advancement of Teaching officially classified it as a research
university.
Georgia Southern’s extensive academics are divided throughout eight
colleges. It also offers online courses, most of which lead to graduate
and doctoral degrees. Business, education, nursing, and kinesiology are
some of the subjects included in the online school.
The university also has much to offer in terms of student life. The city
of Statesboro, which houses GSU, offers southern city charm with a
college-town feel. The Botanical Garden, Center for Wildlife Education,
and Lamar Q Ball, Jr. Raptor Center provide a natural haven to GSU
students. You can also check out exhibits at the Georgia Southern Museum
or the Betty Foy Sanders Department of Art, or catch a show at the
Performing Arts Center.
Financial aid at Georgia Southern is plentiful as well. Scholarships are
based primarily on merit, and some are awarded to students in particular
colleges. GSU also offers an out-of-state fee waiver, so students who
meet certain academic criteria can pay in-state tuition.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Legal, Management, Marketing, Medical & Science, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: North Arkansas College is a school in Harrison.
Full Description:
Located in Harrison, Arkansas, North Arkansas College offers associate’s
degrees and certificate programs to help students explore their interests
and skills. Students are able to take advantage of the quality facilities
while preparing for their next step in life.
North Arkansas College offers associate’s degrees in almost every
traditional concentration, and offers a long list of certificate programs
as well. Certificates can be earned within one year, and include
vocational training for locally in-demand jobs.
North Arkansas College offers a unique bachelor degree partnership
program that allows students to earn their bachelor’s degrees from either
Arkansas Tech University, John Brown University, or Franklin University.
After students complete the associate’s degrees with North Arkansas
College, they are able to choose specific programs with one of these
three universities to take courses on the North Arkansas College campus
and online to fulfill the requirement for a bachelor’s degree. This
program supports the growth of the community by allowing students to earn
a bachelor’s without leaving home.
Students at North Arkansas College are encouraged to take advantage of
the many student support services and student life activities to enrich
their college experience. North Arkansas College is committed to making
sure their students succeed.
Contact Job Departments: Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services
Most Popular Trademark Class: Paper, cardboard and goods made from these materials

Headquarters Location: Winston Salem, North Carolina, United States
Description: Forsyth Technical Community College offers technical education, training programs, and other related services for students.
Full Description:
In order to serve its students’ diverse needs, Forsyth Technical
Community College (FTCC) aims to provide a breadth of academics. It has
certainly been successful in this measure, offering more than 190
programs of study in a vast range of fields. At FTCC, you can study
everything from broadcasting to nanotechnology. The school even offers an
associate’s degree program in Race Car Technology!
Students seeking to transfer to a four-year college can also find
academic support at FTCC. The college maintains enrollment agreements
with the University of North Carolina at Greenboro, Salem College,
Winston-Salem State University and more.
To apply for financial aid at Forsyth Technical Community College, you
should complete the FAFSA no later than June 1. FTCC also offers a number
of scholarships, many of which are based on merit. You need only fill out
a single scholarship application to be considered for these awards;
however, some programs also require an application essay.
As a community college, FTCC has an open admissions policy. Everyone is
welcome to enroll in classes, and most applicants will be accepted to
credit programs. Some programs, especially those in health care, have
more specific and rigorous admissions requirements.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Indiana University - Purdue University, Fort Wayne is a school in Fort Wayne.
Full Description:
More than 250 degree programs, medical research and an engaging arts
community are some of the more exciting features of Indiana
University-Purdue University in Fort Wayne, Indiana (IPFW).
Indiana-Purdue is essentially the fusing of the two universities into the
Fort Wayne campus. As a large urban school, students have many choices of
what to study. Bachelor’s degrees are granted in diverse and high-profile
majors like:
 * Communications
 * Dental Assisting
 * Engineering
 * English Literature
 * Film
 * Occupational Therapy
 * Philosophy
 * Theatre
There are also more obscure majors, such as:
 * Ceramics
 * Folklore
 * Music Therapy
 * Peace and Conflict Studies
College life at IPFW includes opportunities for students to perform in
plays and music productions and exhibit artwork. There are also more than
100 student organizations.
There are different categories of admission. Standard undergraduate
admissions require that students have at least a 2.8 grade point average,
have scored at least 450 on each SAT section and be at least in the top
50% of their graduating class.
Adult admissions are for anyone who graduated from high school at least 2
years ago. Adult students must have graduated in the top half of their
class, have taken college prep classes and have a grade point average of
at least 2.9. Those with a GED must have a GED score of at least 580.
Financial aid includes merit scholarships, which are awarded to those
with an SAT of 1650 or above or an ACT score of at least 24 who are in
the top 24% of their graduating high school class.
State aid is also available. In order to be considered for state aid,
students must fill out a FAFSA by March 10th prior to entry in the fall.
Federal aid is also available, includes loans and Pell grants, and is
primarily need-based.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Medical & Science, Operations, Pro Services, Sales

Description: Bay Path College is a school in Longmeadow.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
Versatility is the key component of Bay Path College’s academics. The
college offers a traditional liberal arts undergraduate experience, as
well as graduate programs, “Saturday college” for working adults and
distance learning.
About 20 undergraduate programs and nearly a dozen graduate programs are
available. Additionally, Bay Path has a degree completion program as one
of its distance learning opportunities.
With more than 30 student organizations, college life at Bay Path offers
plenty to explore. The school also participates in NCAA Division III
athletics, and has many club sports and other fitness programs.
As a women’s college, Bay Path offers undergraduate admissions to female
applicants only. However, male students can apply for its graduate
programs. Admissions requirements vary depending on the program you apply
for, so check the college’s website for specific procedures.
Financial aid options may vary based on the program, as well. Generally
speaking, federal financial aid is the primary source for tuition
assistance, but Bay Path also funds a number of scholarships that can
provide up to $60,000 towards the education of eligible students.

Description: Westfield State University is a school.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
A top school in the Massachusetts State University System, Westfield State University in Westfield, Massachusetts is ideal for both commuter students and those who wish to live on campus. 
Westfield State offers a range of liberal arts and professional degree programs at the undergraduate and graduate levels. Art, Computer Information Science, Criminal Justice, English, Ethnic and Gender Studies, Music, Nursing, Social Work, Theatre and World Literature are just some examples. 
Westfield State, while educating many students from Western Massachusetts and nearby New England regions, has a large number of residential students.
However, Westfield State also honors the working adult student and his or her needs by offering courses part-time and evening schedules as well as courses through continuing education.
Student life at Westfield State offers much in the way of the arts and other activities. Westfield State is home to a student-run radio station and television station as well as student art galleries, a student jazz ensemble and a thriving theatre arts department. There are also intramural sports, a thriving Greek life and over 70 recreational, cultural and academic clubs to choose from.
Student services include an academic achievement center, career services, health services, a counseling center, and financial aid offerings for eligible students including scholarships, loans and grants.
Contact Job Departments: Finance, Information Technology, Operations

Description: Tunxis Community College is a school in Farmington.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
In the Farmington, Connecticut area, Tunxis Community College has
academic, workforce training, and personal enrichment courses for
students with all sorts of different interests that can earn you an
associate’s degree or certificate.
Among the many majors to choose from are programs such as Allied Health,
Graphic Design, Visual Fine Arts, Business Office Technology, Computer
Information Systems, Criminal Justice, Drug and Alcohol Recovery
Counselor, Early Childhood Education, Engineering Science and Technology
Studies, and New Media Communication, as well as many more.
Counselors in the financial aid office can point you toward programs that
will help you earn loans, grants, scholarships, veteran’s benefits, and
more if you qualify. These financial aid options can help you pay for
tuition and other expenses.
Student life at TCC includes a student lounge, The Cyber Café, and the
Barnes-Franklin Gallery, which is filled with student, community, and
professional art.
Academic advising is available for any student who needs help. The career
center can help students find employment. Other student resources
includes child care, health care, media center, and student activities.

Description: The Indian Institute of Technology Delhi is a public research university located in Delhi, India.
Full Description:
Vision:
To contribute to India and the World through excellence in scientific and technical education and research; to serve as a valuable resource for industry and society; and remain a source of pride for all Indians.
Mission:
To generate new knowledge by engaging in cutting-edge research and to promote academic growth by offering state-of-the-art undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programmes.
To identify, based on an informed perception of Indian, regional and global needs, areas of specialization upon which the institute can concentrate.
To undertake collaborative projects which offer opportunities for long-term interaction with academia and industry.
To develop human potential to its fullest extent so that intellectually capable and imaginatively gifted leaders can emerge in a range of professions.
Values:
Academic integrity and accountability.
Respect and tolerance for the views of every individual.
Attention to issues of national relevance as well as of global concern.
Breadth of understanding, including knowledge of the human sciences.
Appreciation of intellectual excellence and creativity.
An unfettered spirit of exploration, rationality and enterprise.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Management, Operations

Organization Name: University of Pittsburgh - School of Engineering
Description: Swanson School of Engineering is the engineering school of the University of Pittsburgh in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Full Description: The University of Pittsburgh’s Swanson School of Engineering is one of the oldest engineering programs in the United States and is consistently ranked among the top 25 public engineering programs nationally. The Swanson School has excelled in basic and applied research during the past decade and is on the forefront of 21st century technology including sustainability, energy systems, bioengineering, micro- and nanosystems, computational modeling, and advanced materials development.

Description: Diman Regional Technical Institute is a school in Fall River.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
Providing highly personalized career training, professional work
opportunities and extracurricular involvement, Diman Regional Vocational
Technical High School in Fall River, Massachusetts, offers high school
students the chance to succeed.
Since Diman is a public high school, all students are given an academic
foundation, taking courses in English, Science, Social Studies and Math.
Students receive close attention from instructors in all of their
classes, whether getting vocational training in Auto Mechanics, Culinary
Arts, Dental Assisting, Graphic Communications or another field offered
at Diman.
Diman’s co-operative work program is another highlight of the school. In
the co-op program, students work at jobs in their field under the
supervision of faculty.
Diman also has a job-placement service for students who wish to move
directly from Diman into a career.
Extracurricular activities are multi-faceted. Recreational clubs such as
the chess, photography or theatre clubs provide an opportunity for
creative expression.
Other student organizations, such as the Honors Society or Skills USA
group, offer chances for students to advance academically and even
compete nationally in skills competitions, which may result in
scholarship awards.
For information on how to apply to Diman contact a school representative
or simply fill out an application online.
Top Five Investors: Massachusetts Life Sciences Center, Massachusetts Clean Energy Center
Contact Job Departments: Management, Operations, Pro Services

Description: Dhaka College is a school in Dhaka.
College for Technical Education is a school in Lexington.
Full Description:
The College of Technical Education (CTE) in Lexington, Kentucky offers
career training that focuses not only on the skills of the discipline,
but on the skills needed to secure jobs.
Programs at the College of Technical Education include certifications in
Medical Assisting, Cosmetology, Food Service and Early Childhood
Education.
Since most programs take a year or less to complete, the time spent in
school is short. For that reason it is also intense and focused.
Students in all of CTE’s programs learn through hands-on work in their
field. Not only that, but as soon as students begin their program at CTE
they are assigned employment consultants.
Consultants help them throughout the year with resume writing, mock
interviews, job-searching and obtaining part-time work in their field
while still in school.
Consultations for additional issues are also offered for students who
have never worked due to disability or other impediments.
Financial aid is available for eligible students. Instructions on how to
apply and on types of aid available may be obtained from a CTE financial
aid counselor.
Contact Job Departments: Operations

Description: BU Hariri Institute for Computing is a Leveraging the Computational Perspective in a Data-Driven World for a Better Society.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Boston Area, East Coast, New England
Full Description: The Rafik B. Hariri Institute for Computing and Computational Science & Engineering initiates, catalyzes, and propels collaborative, interdisciplinary research and training initiatives for a better society by promoting (a) discovery and innovations through the use of computational and data-driven approaches, and (b) advances in the science of computing inspired by challenges in arts and sciences, engineering, and management disciplines.

Organization Name: Manav Rachna International Institute Of Research And Studies
Description: Manav Rachna International Institute Of Research And Studies (MRIIRS) (Formerly known as Manav Rachna International University)
Full Description:
Manav Rachna International Institute Of Research And Studies (MRIIRS) (Formerly known as Manav Rachna International University) is a visible symbol of knowledge and experience providing high-quality education in the fields of Engineering & Technology, Health and Applied Sciences, Management, Computer Applications, Hotel Management, International Programs, Commerce, Humanities, Media, Architecture, Design and much more. Recently, the university has been awarded 5 Star QS rating for teaching, facilities and employability and an overall rating of 3 stars and is a NAAC accredited ‘A’ Grade Institution.
MRIIRS has more than 56 global academic collaborations for Research and Academic exchange programs. The institute also has tie-ups with Indian Oil Corporation, R&D Centre, Faridabad; Translational Health Science and Technology Institute, Faridabad; Council of Scientific & Industrial Research – Indian Institute of Petroleum, Dehradun; and National Institute of Immunology, New Delhi.
MRIIRS have Eight Research and Innovation Clusters at the campus and have Centres of Excellence in collaboration with the reputed companies like Mitsubishi, Honda, Reliance Jio, and Sky Tester for enhancing research skills.

Description: Somerset Community College is a community where students find confidence, collaboration, compassion and success.

Headerquarters Regions: San Francisco Bay Area, West Coast, Western US
Full Description:
Stanford GSB is a business management school that creates ideas that deepen and advance understanding of management. It offers a general management Master of Business Administration degree, a full-time twelve-month MS in Management for mid-career executives, and a Ph.D. program, along with a number of joint degrees with other schools at Stanford University including Earth Sciences, Education, Engineering, Law and Medicine. 
The Stanford Graduate School of Business was established in 1925 in Stanford, California. It currently has 114 acedemic staff, 2,284 students, 101 doctoral students, and 882 postgraduate students.

Organization Name: The University of Texas of the Permian Basin
Description: The University of Texas of the Permian Basin is a school in Odessa.
Full Description:
One of two UT System schools in West Texas, the University of Texas of
the Permian Basin (UTPB) provides an alternative to the much larger
University of Texas at El Paso. Yet while it enrolls much fewer students,
UTPB still offers a wide range of academics. More than 40 undergraduate
majors are available, including unique programs like Leadership Studies
and Petroleum Engineering.
In terms of graduate studies, UTPB offers about 20 programs. These
include an MBA that can be completed on campus or online, a Master of
Professional Accountancy and several programs in the arts & sciences.
UT Permian Basin’s admissions requirements vary depending on the type of
applicant. For incoming freshmen, your eligibility is based on your class
ranking and SAT/ACT scores. If you’re in the top 10% of your class, you
don’t need to send in standardized test scores (except for merit
scholarship consideration). On the other hand, if your class ranking is
low, you can make up for it with high SAT or ACT scores.
In addition to federal financial aid, UT Permian Basin funds many
scholarship programs. Merit scholarships for incoming students can earn
you up to $26,000 towards your tuition. UTPB will also match
community-based scholarships up to $1,000.

Description: University of Ghana is providing and promoting university education, learning, and research.
Full Description:
The University of Ghana, the premier university and the largest university in Ghana was founded as the University College of the Gold Coast by Ordinance on August 11, 1948 for the purpose of providing and promoting university education, learning and research. 
As a University poised to distinguish itself in the area of research to make an impact at the national and international level, the University has launched a new Strategic Plan. This new strategic plan (2014-2024) is intended to consolidate the gains made from the review of the University’s mission and practices and situate these within the context of a very dynamic environment of higher education in Ghana and beyond. 
In addition, the University has several research institutions and centres for learning and research, including Noguchi Memorial Institute for Medical Research (NMIR), Centre for Tropical, Clinical Pharmacology and Therapeutics, Regional Institute for Population Studies, Institute for Environmental and Sanitation Studies and the Institute for Statistical, Social and Economic Research. 
As part of its vision to become a world class research intensive institution, University of Ghana has identified four priority areas where the university will focus and promote international collaboration in research initiatives to enhance the University’s research output. 
As the leading university in Ghana, the University aims to produce the next generation of thought leaders to drive national development. Through our research institutes and other centres of learning and research, faculty members are involved in studies that support policy making for national development, often in collaboration with other international institutions. 
There are currently a number of Ghanaian and international institutions that hold affiliation with the University of Ghana. As a leader in tertiary education, the University has established several link agreements with universities in Africa, Europe and North America for student, faculty and staff exchange as well as collaborative research. 
The student population is over 38,000 made up of students enrolled on our regular programmes, sandwich programmes, and distance education as well as students from affiliate institutions. University of Ghana's growing number of international students come from over 70 countries to join either our regular undergraduate and graduate programmes, enroll on their study abroad and other special programmes designed for international students. 
The University of Ghana, has over the years built an image as one of the continent’s reputable universities which makes the University of Ghana the first choice for academics, researchers and students.
Contact Job Departments: Medical & Science, Pro Services
