Organization Name: Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School
Description: Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School is a school in Billerica.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Boston Area, East Coast, New England
Full Description:
Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School offers a unique
experience to high school students ready to receive hands-on education
and vocational training. Primarily a high school for students in grades
9-12, Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School also offers
some adult education courses for students 18 years and older.
Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School offers standard
high school courses to fulfill English, math, science, social science and
physical education requirements. However, Shawsheen Valley Regional
Vocational Technical School also offers vocational courses to the
career-minded in many areas including Communications, Construction,
Mechanical, Health Services, Cosmetology, Culinary Arts, Transportation
and several more. Students are able to take courses in their vocational
interests and develop their skills for a future career.
Adult education at Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School
includes programs offering apprenticeships, licensing and courses for
self-improvement. Many professionals use adult education programs such as
this one to keep up with changing technology in their field, or to
improve existing skills.
Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical School is committed to
helping students focus on their future career goals by promoting the
required skills. Though Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational Technical
School is a vocational high school, teachers and staff encourage students
to explore higher education after graduation as well. Whatever route you
or perhaps your child may take, Shawsheen Valley Regional Vocational
Technical School is a great place to start.
Contact Job Departments: Management, Pro Services

Description: Full Sail University is a for-profit university located in Winter Park, Florida.
Full Description:
Full Sail University
Whether it's video games, film, recording, art and design, web
technology, or the business behind music and entertainment, Full Sail
University's campus and online degree programs offer immersive
educational experiences centered around the needs of the entertainment
and media industry.
Creative Campus
Located in Winter Park, Florida (just minutes from Orlando), the Full
Sail campus has the look and feel of a creative studio environment,
complete with industry-standard recording studios, spacious film
soundstages, a motion capture studio, game studios, and a professional
performing arts venue - all housed in a 191-acre multimedia complex.
Technology-Driven Learning
Both campus and online students work within Full Sail's interactive
online-based platform. Since students all use the same online learning
system, it allows us to push the boundaries with our course content -
offering a truly multimedia learning experience.
Through Project LaunchBox TM, both campus and online students receive a
MacBook Pro at a deep institutional discount, pre-equipped with
professional software. The Mac serves as a personal workstation, allowing
students to work and create wherever they are.
Industry Advisory Boards
Each program has an advisory board comprised of working professionals who
continually update Full Sail on the needs of their industry. Since Full
Sail courses are offered on a monthly basis, each program's curriculum
can stay up-to-date with advances in the real world.
Real-World Opportunities
From assisting with production on the nationally syndicated Daily Buzz
(filmed on campus), to working alongside ESPN pros on game intros, to
designing motion graphics for the Orlando Magic, to working with lights,
sound, and set design at our Live Venue, many students are able to gain
experience on real-world, high-profile projects.
Graduate Success
With more than 37,000 alumni, Full Sail University graduates have worked
in many different roles for some of the industry's most well-known
companies and contributed to countless notable projects:
 
 * Films like The Avengers, the Twilight series, and Batman: The Dark
 Knight Rises
 * Albums by Jay-Z, Linkin Park and Kayne West
 * Games like Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, Madden NFL Series and Call of
 Duty: Modern Warfare 3
For disclosure information,
http://www.fullsail.edu/outcomes-and-statistics
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services, Product, Sales

Description: Lorain County Community College is a community college located in Elyria, Ohio
Full Description:
The Lorain Community College in Elyria, Ohio, is one of the leading
junior colleges in the state, offering students the extensive learning
resources of a four-year university in its close-knit community
environment.
Lorain is one of the only colleges in Ohio that allows students to earn a
bachelor’s or master’s degree from any Ohio university without even
leaving the campus.
The school contains a number of learning resources, including an upscale
technology center for local businesses and industries and the Fab Lab for
information technology students.
Academics at Lorain include more than 85 associate’s degrees and
occupational certification programs in a variety of disciplines,
including:
 * Communication and Creative Arts
 * Health Care
 * Science and Mathematics
 * Computer/Information Technology
 * Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction
Your college life at Lorain will be enhanced by its numerous enrichment
options. Whether you are seeking to explore personal interests, gain
professional experience or meet lifelong friends at a campus social
event, Lorain has the opportunities for you.
When you are not studying, you can catch an event at the Stocker Arts
Center, attend a seminar at the Spitzer Conference Center or volunteer
for community outreach activities at the Public Services Institute.
Lorain Community College admissions require an official high school
transcript or GED, the COMPASS assessment exam and a FAFSA for financial
aid and scholarship consideration.

Description: MIT Sloan is on a mission to develop principled, innovative leaders who improve the world and to generate ideas.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater Boston Area, East Coast, New England
Full Description:
The MIT Sloan School of Management, based in Cambridge, Massachusetts, is one of the world’s leading business schools — conducting cutting-edge research and providing management education to top students from more than 60 countries. The School is part of MIT’s rich intellectual tradition of education and research.
MIT Sloan began in 1914 as engineering administration curriculum in the MIT Department of Economics and Statistics. The scope and depth of this educational focus have grown steadily in response to advances in the theory and practice of management to today’s broad-based management school.
A program offering a master’s degree in management was established in 1925. The world’s first university-based executive education program — the MIT Sloan Fellows — was created in 1931 under the sponsorship of Alfred P. Sloan, Jr., an 1895 MIT graduate who was then chairman of General Motors. An MIT Sloan Foundation grant established the MIT School of Industrial Management in 1952 with a charge of educating the “ideal manager.”
Industry Groups: Community and Lifestyle, Education, Financial Services

Description: The University of Melbourne is an Australian public university located in Melbourne, Victoria.
Full Description: Established in 1853, the University of Melbourne is a public-spirited institution that makes distinctive contributions to society in research, learning and teaching and engagement. It’s consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, with international rankings of world universities placing it as number 1 in Australia and number 33 in the world (Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2014-2015).

Description: Hood College is a school in Frederick.
Headerquarters Regions: Washington DC Metro Area, East Coast, Southern US
Full Description:
A small, intimate school, Hood College offers a highly personalized
academic and social environment as well as numerous opportunities both
within and beyond the classroom.
Located in Frederick, Maryland, Hood College’s small campus is made up of
beautiful historic buildings and natural beauty.
Academics at Hood are based in the liberal arts and include more than 25
major subjects at the undergraduate level and over a dozen master’s
degrees.
With a low faculty ratio and a relatively small student body classes
remain small giving students optimum one-on-one time with professors.
This is particularly exciting since most professors hold a terminal
degree.
However, while small, Hood is not lacking in opportunities. Encouraging
students to do internships in their field of study, Hood can often offer
positions at such places as American Red Cross, CNN, the French Embassy,
National Geographic, the Library of Congress and the White House.
Most students live on campus in one of Hood’s residence halls. This gives
them the chance to regularly take advantage of Hood’s student life
offerings. These include more than 60 student clubs and organizations,
honors societies and NCAA athletics.
The admission requirements to Hood vary depending on whether one is a
freshman, transfer student or graduate school applicant.
Financial aid is available to eligible students who require tuition
assistance to attend school.
Founders: Adrian C. McCardell, John Henry Apple

Headquarters Location: New York, New York, United States
Description: The Institute for Integrative Nutrition is a holistic nutrition school that offers the world’s largest online Health Coach training program.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater New York Area, East Coast, Northeastern US
Full Description:
The Institute for Integrative Nutrition (IIN) was founded in 1992 and has educated more than 100,000 students and graduates worldwide. Its mission is to empower students to change the world through optimal health and happiness.
The Health Coach Training Program, IIN’s signature offering, is a year-long online course that covers a wide variety of nutrition, wellness and business topics. Using the IIN Learning Center app, students can learn from anywhere with any compatible device. 
Students learn more than 100 dietary theories as well as nutrition concepts like bio-individuality, primary food, emotional eating and superfoods, among others. In preparation for a career in health coaching, students receive guidance on marketing, business building, time management, coaching, listening and public speaking; they are also equipped with a website, health coaching materials, and marketing materials such as business cards and newsletter templates.
Founder and Director Joshua Rosenthal leads most of the lectures. Additionally, many leaders in business, wellness, and holistic health serve as guest speakers, including Deepak Chopra, MD, Andrew Weil, MD, Geneen Roth, David Wolfe, Arianna Huffington, and more.
IIN has been licensed by the New York State Education Department since 2009 and is recognized by the The National College Credit Recommendation Service (NCCRS). Through its partnership with colleges and universities across the US, IIN graduates earn up to 40 college credits that can be applied towards a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or a Continuing Education Certificate. Educational partnerships include International Health Coach University, Saybrook University, Qualifi, SUNY Purchase, Maryland University of Integrative Health, Goddard College, California Institute of Integral Studies (CIIS), and Excelsior College.
The Institute for Integrative Nutrition offers additional courses and programs that build off its Health Coach Training Program. Geared towards graduates looking to expand their knowledge in various areas of interest, IIN offers courses in advanced business, gut health, hormone health, emotional eating psychology and coaching. Joshua also leads the Launch Your Dream Book course, a step-by-step guide for graduates looking to get published.
IIN is recognized as an accredited business by the Better Business Bureau and holds an A+ rating.
Top Five Investors: Norwest Equity Partners (NEP), Norwest Mezzanine Partners

Description: North Shore Community College is a school in Danvers.

North Shore Community College is truly a community-oriented school. Its
academics serve virtually every need, from transfer to vocational
training to ESL. North Shore Community College even offers progressively
minded associate’s degree programs like Environmental Horticulture and
Environmental Studies, for students interested in improving the world

College life at North Shore Community College is active and engaged.
There are plenty of ways to get involved on campus, with plenty of

might choose to join Christ on Campus, and those interested in

Financial aid is available at North Shore Community College. In addition

The school requires all students to choose a program of study before
applying; if you need help with this step, feel free to contact the
admissions office for some academic advising. Placement tests are also
required to gauge your basic skills.

Description: American Institute of Holistic Theology is a school in Birmingham.
Full Description:
American Institute of Holistic Theology is a truly unique institution. An
exclusively online school, AIHT offers interfaith ministerial degrees at
the undergraduate and graduate levels.
Academics include bachelor’s and master’s degrees in:
 * Holistic Theology
 * Holistic Ministries
 * Holistic Health and Spiritual Care
All of AIHT’s programs incorporate the study of different faiths and
religious traditions, including:
 * Buddhism
 * Christianity
 * Islam
 * Metaphysics
Students may also become ordained and work as ministers in Christian
churches, interfaith churches and other spiritual communities.
Since all of AIHT’s programs are online, students are often working
adults. They also live in different states throughout the country and
even in other countries.
AIHT offers financial aid through private loans. They also offer six
different flexible tuition payment plans. Tuition discounts are available
for senior citizens and members of the clergy. AIHT also gives tuition
discounts based on previous degrees or professional work experience.
Anyone with a high school diploma or GED may enroll at AIHT by phone, by
mail or online. Anyone with a bachelor’s degree may enroll in a master’s
degree program in the same manner.

Organization Name: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani
Description: The Birla Institute of Technology & Science (BITS), Pilani is an all-India institute for higher education.
Full Description:
The Birla Institute of Technology & Science, BITS Pilani is an all-India Institute for higher education. The primary motive of BITS is to "train young men and women able and eager to create and put into action such ideas, methods, techniques and information". The Institute is a dream come true of its founder late Mr G.D.Birla - an eminent industrialist, a participant in Indian freedom struggle and a close associate of the Father of Indian Nation late Mr. Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi (Mahatma Gandhi). What started in early 1900s as a small school, blossomed into a set of colleges for higher education, ranging from the Humanities to Engineering until 1964 when all these colleges amalgamated to culminate into a unique Indian University of International standing. This university was christened as the Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, known to many as BITS, Pilani.
Over the years, BITS has provided the highest quality technical education to students from all over India admitted on the basis of merit. Its graduates may be found throughout the world in all areas of engineering, science and commerce. BITS symbolizes the maturing of Indian technical ability and "can-do" entrepreneurial spirit, especially as derived from the private sector. BITS is located in the Vidya Vihar campus adjacent to the town of Pilani in Rajasthan.
BITS mission is to advance knowledge and educate students in science, technology, and other areas of scholarship that will best serve the nation and the world in the 21st century.The Institute is committed to generating, disseminating, and preserving knowledge, and to working with others to bring this knowledge to bear on the world's great challenges. BITS is dedicated to providing its students with an education that combines rigorous academic study and the excitement of discovery with the support and intellectual stimulation of a diverse campus community. They seek to develop in each member of the BITS community the ability and passion to work wisely, creatively, and effectively for the betterment of humankind.
Contact Job Departments: Finance, Human Resources, Management, Operations

Description: Brunswick Community College is a school in Bolivia.
Full Description:
Career training, academic programs and lively entertainment and cultural
offerings may all be found at Brunswick Community College (BCC) in
Supply, North Carolina.
Some of BCC’s academic offerings include art and science majors for those
who wish to transfer to a four-year university. For those who want to
prepare for a professional trade there are programs in Computer Repair,
Medical Assisting, Pharmacy Technology, Office Administration, Plumbing
and Welding, among others.
A large part of BCC’s student life offerings may be found at the Odell
Williamson Auditorium, a 1,500-seat venue that features musical, dance
and theatre performances as well as lectures from renowned performers,
artists and authors.
Student services include academic and career advising, disability
services and a student mentoring program.
Students interested in attending Brunswick must provide proof of a high
school diploma or GED, as well as copies of transcripts. All students
must also take an assessment or placement exam prior to enrolling.
Tuition for in-state students is significantly reduced. Financial aid is
available to those who qualify.

Description: Misericordia University is a school in Dallas.
Full Description:
Misericordia University, a small, Catholic school in Dallas,
Pennsylvania, truly embodies the Catholic mission of service and support
by offering traditional as well as alternative degree programs for
individuals of all backgrounds.
Majors at Misericordia include Business, various concentrations in fine
arts, liberal arts and professional healthcare, and service-oriented
fields like Nursing, Occupational Therapy and Social Work.
Many of Misericordia’s approximately 2,000 students come directly from
high school to earn a bachelor’s degree.
However, Misericordia also provides degree programs for those from less
conventional backgrounds. Its program for single mothers, for example,
allows those in this situation to earn a bachelor’s degree on a schedule
that’s workable for them, and also grants financial aid and other types
of support.
There is also the Expressway program, another flexible alternative to a
bachelor’s degree designed exclusively for working adults.
Additional alternative options may be found in Misericordia’s graduate
program offerings and through the Division of Continuing and Adult
Education.
Since Misericordia is a small college, students may benefit from
personalized services that provide counseling, career coaching, academic
advising and other means of support.
There are also more than 40 student clubs and a campus ministry program
that provide opportunities to socialize with fellow students while also
pursuing an outside interest.
A fairly competitive school, Misericordia usually admits traditional
undergraduate freshmen who are in the top quarter of their high school
class. However, standards for other applicants may differ depending on
whether one is applying as a transfer, alternative or graduate student.
Financial aid is awarded through various sources to eligible students.

Founded in1927, Menlo College is a private undergraduate college offering various programs in liberal arts, mass communication and business. Located in Silicon Valley, Menlo College is also a great place to network with business professionals and entrepreneurs as well.
Menlo College offers a wide variety of majors to its students. Some of those majors include Accounting, Finance, Marketing Communications, Sports Management and Real Estate. Other majors include Human Resource Management, Media Management, Psychology and International Management.
Along with various academic offerings, Menlo College offers many services to its students that include dining services, human resources, conferences and events. Athletics are also important at Menlo College with sports that include men and women’s cross country, soccer and wrestling.

Description: Western Governors University is a school in Salt Lake City.
Full Description:
The principal mission of Western Governors University is to improve quality and expand access to post-secondary educational opportunities by providing a means for individuals to learn independent of time and place and to earn competency-based degrees and other credentials that are credible to both academic institutions and employers.
Truly a university without boundaries, Western Governors University is a non-profit university founded and supported by 19 state governors to serve the needs of today's citizens. At no other time in the history of higher education have the governors of several states joined together to create a university. In addition, WGU is supported by over 20 leading U.S. corporations and foundations. 
Western Governors University is an online university driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs. WGU has flourished into a national university, serving over 14,000 students from all 50 states.
The university continues to open doors for adult learners who need flexibility to achieve their education and career goals. WGU’s innovative competency-based academic approach makes it possible, allowing individuals to fit their education into their lives, not the other way around.

Description: Mayland Community College is a school in Spruce Pine.
Full Description:
Students in the Mitchell, Avery and Yancey Counties in North Carolina who
are looking for industry training certificates or associate’s for
transfer degrees should look into the Mayland Community College, centered
in Spruce Pine, North Carolina.
The college aims to accommodate the needs of all students with its
variety of academics, including more than 35 technical and transfer
programs in the arts, business, pre-professional paths and health
sciences.
To provide students with a well-rounded experience, the college offers
many recreational and social events designed to not only introduce
students to lifelong friends, but expose them to new interests, cultures
and ways of thinking. Movie nights, career fairs, blood drives and school
dances are only some of the ways you can get involved with college life.
The MCC Learning Resources Center is another great resource of Mayland.
It contains not only numerous books and reference materials, but also the

The college maintains partnerships with area universities and colleges to

considered for enrollment.
To encourage students in the local community to further their education,
the college offers in-state tuition discounts. Students seeking
additional forms of financial aid must file a FAFSA.

Description: The Columbia Center is a business school offering its students college degrees.
Headerquarters Regions: Greater New York Area, East Coast, Northeastern US
Full Description:
Columbia Business School was first founded in 1916, thanks in part to a generous gift from the banking executive Emerson McMillin. There were 11 faculty members on our initial staff, teaching an inaugural class of 61, including eight women. Today, as the School has evolved to meet the needs of an ever-changing business world, both our numbers and our reach have multiplied. Columbia Business School is an ivy league school. 
In addition to the Full-Time MBA, the School now offers several Executive MBA options, as well as doctoral and master of science degrees and robust Executive Education opportunities. Throughout this evolution, we have maintained an unwavering commitment to improving the world of business through cutting-edge research, innovative education, and an expanding global network.

Description: We are the United States Navy, our Nation's sea power - ready guardians of peace, victorious in war.
Headerquarters Regions: Washington DC Metro Area, East Coast, Southern US
Full Description:
The U.S. Navy was founded on 13 October 1775, and the Department of the Navy was established on 30 April 1798. The Department of the Navy has three principal components: The Navy Department, consisting of executive offices mostly in Washington, D.C.; the operating forces, including the Marine Corps, the reserve components, and, in time of war, the U.S. Coast Guard (in peace, a component of the Department of Homeland Security); and the shore establishment. 
We are professional Sailors and Civilians - a diverse and agile force exemplifying the highest standards of service to our Nation, at home and abroad, at sea and ashore.
Integrity is the foundation of our conduct; respect for others is fundamental to our character; decisive leadership is crucial to our success.
We are a team, disciplined and well-prepared, committed to mission accomplishment. We do not waver in our dedication and accountability to our shipmates and families.
We are patriots, forged by the Navy's core values of Honor, Courage and Commitment. In times of war and peace, our actions reflect our proud heritage and tradition.
We defend our Nation and prevail in the face of adversity with strength, determination, and dignity.
We are the United States Navy.

Description: MEST provides training, investment, and mentoring for aspiring African technology entrepreneurs.
Full Description:
The Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology provides training, investment, and mentoring for aspiring African technology entrepreneurs with the goal of creating globally successful companies that create wealth and jobs locally in Africa. 
The program begins at the campus of the Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST) in Accra, Ghana, with a rigorous, one year, full-time program. Out of an applicant pool of over 2,500 candidates, MEST selects between 50 to 60 top Ghanaian, Nigerian, Kenyan and South African university graduates to receive comprehensive training across the spectrum of skills required to build successful technology businesses, including software development, product management, finance, marketing, sales, and leadership best practices. 
After completion of the program, the students (called Entrepreneurs in training – EITs) have an opportunity to pitch a business to the Meltwater Foundation. Successful teams receive a seed round of funding, and are accepted into the MEST Incubator, which offers subsidized facilities, continued education programming, and access to the Foundation's global network of advisers. Incubator teams also enjoy access to a suite of legal, financial, and marketing services.

Description: Berkshire Community College is a school in Pittsfield.
Headerquarters Regions: East Coast, New England, Northeastern US
Full Description:
As Massachusetts’ first community college, Berkshire provides several
resources to residents of the county, such as workforce development and
personal enrichment classes.
The school’s main function, however, is as a starting point for
college-bound high school graduates. Berkshire Community College provides
an affordable way to start your postsecondary study before transferring
to a four-year institution.
Berkshire Community College’s academics include nearly 50 programs of
study. The school confers associate of arts, associate of science and
certificate programs in subjects ranging from Engineering Technology to
Peace and World Order.
BCC’s associate of arts curriculum meets the requirements of the
Massachusetts Transfer Compact. This means that after earning your AA,
you can transfer to any number of in-state institutions. Under the new
MassTransfer policy, all students are guaranteed full credit transfer to
the school of their choice. Additionally, students with a 2.5 GPA or
higher are guaranteed admission, and those with GPA above 3.0 are
eligible for a tuition discount.
Most financial aid at Berkshire Community College comes from federal
sources. Pell grants, student loans and work-study can be paired with
state assistance like the MASSGrant to help you meet your financial need.
Contact Job Departments: Engineering, Finance, Human Resources, Management, Marketing, Operations, Pro Services

Description: McKendree University is a school in Lebanon.
Full Description:
The McKendree University in Lebanon, Illinois, offers rigorous, broad
liberal arts programs with the goal of preparing graduates to be the
leaders of tomorrow.
The university maintains a historical relationship with the United
Methodist Church and its tradition of Judeo-Christian values. While
religion is not integrated in the curricula, the school encourages open
dialogue, inquiry and mutual respect among students of various
backgrounds.
The school offers many resources for spiritual students, including campus
ministries, service programs, mission trips and ministry employment
opportunities.
Even if you don’t have a faith background, student life at McKendree is
still rich in resources. You can join an academic fraternity or honor
society, social Greek organization, academic interest club or a special
interest club. When you’re not in class, you can participate in
multicultural events, social activities or music and theatre
performances.
Academics include more than 45 undergraduate majors and 35 minors in
fields like business, education, information technology, management and
more. There are also 4 graduate programs offered in Education,
Professional Counseling, Business Administration and Nursing and a
doctoral program in Education.
Admissions require students to submit a counselor recommendation form
(available on the website), official ACT/SAT scores, previous educational
transcripts and an application.
Students who complete a FAFSA will be considered to receive financial
aid. Forms of assistance include federal Pell grants, SEO grants, Perkins
and PLUS loans and work-study programs.

Full Description:
_DSC2893
TeenSHARP was founded in 2009 to increase underrepresented students’ access to college and develop student-leaders who are Successful, High-Achieving, and Reaching Potential (SHARP). Since then, TeenSHARP evolved into an organization that gives low-income and minority youth access to premier leadership opportunities, trains them to be ambassadors of higher education in their communities, and prepares them for success at selective colleges and universities. TeenSHARP operates one site at Rutgers University’s Camden-Campus where it serves Philadelphia and Southern New Jersey students beginning in grade 6 with full-day programming each Saturday, school year-round. In the fall of 2015, TeenSHARP launched its second site at the University of Delaware serving scholars in grades 9 – 12 from all 3 counties in Delaware.
TeenSHARP’s trajectory-altering college-preparatory program equips scholars with the strategic knowledge and tools to be unapologetically excellent at the nation’s most selective colleges and universities. Organization Name: Kansas City University of Medicine and Biosciences
Description: Kansas City University of Medicine and Biosciences is a school in Kansas City.
Full Description:
Kansas City University of Medicine and Biosciences (KCUMB) is a highly
specialized medical school in Kansas City, Missouri. KCUMB offers
advanced degrees in osteopathic medicine and medical research. KCUMB also
provides maximum opportunities to enhance professional skills, work with
patients and receive mentoring.
KCUMB’s academics include a doctorate in Osteopathic Medicine and
master’s degrees in Biomedical Sciences and Bioethics.
Students in the Biomedical and Bioethics programs conduct research
alongside faculty. Osteopathic Medicine students receive much of their
hands-on experience by undertaking clinical assignments.
KCUMB’s student organizations provide opportunities for professional
networking and enhancement. They also give students the chance to meet
others from a similar background. Student clubs include:
 * Catholic Students in Medicine Association
 * Dermatology Club
 * Sports Medicine Association
 * Student Osteopathic Anesthesia Organization
 * Women in Medicine Club
KCUMB also has extensive mentoring opportunities. All students have a
faculty advisor who meets with them regularly throughout their program.
Students have the chance to network with alumni, as well. They may even
offer mentoring themselves through the Big Brother/Sister alliance.
Osteopathic Medicine students may also offer community service and gain
professional experience by volunteering for free health screening
programs.
Admissions requirements are different for each program. Applicants to the
osteopathy program should have a total score of at least 23 on the MCAT
and a GPA of at least 3.25. A certain number of classes in the sciences
are also required.
KCUMB awards a number of scholarships, of varying amounts. KCUMB awards
scholarships to those with a high GPA and MCAT scores. There are also
diversity scholarships and scholarships for military. Other types of
financial aid include research fellowships and student loans.

Full Description:

It is notable for its research, particularly in Math, Applied Sciences and Medicine, as well as its history with political activism, especially during apartheid, where the University was a bastion for liberal progressivism and anti-apartheid demonstrations.

Description: James Madison University is a public coeducational research university located in Harrisonburg, Virginia, United States.
Full Description:
The James Madison University in Harrisonburg, Virginia, provides each
student with an exceptional education through outstanding scholarship and
innovate thinking in a community dedicated to knowledge.
The university is dedicated to helping the local and global community.
Many students join groups like the Peace Corps Volunteers and Be the
Change to help the world through environmental stewardship, global
affairs, nonviolence awareness and more.
Student life at the university is immersed in activity. Whether they join
one of the school’s 300 student clubs or take an internship overseas,
students find learning opportunities both in and out of the classroom.
The school hosts many multicultural events throughout the year, allowing
students to be exposed to diverse cultures.
Academics at the school include a broad range of undergraduate degrees in
colleges of Arts and Letters, Business, Education, Integrated Science and
Technology, Visual and Performing Arts and more. Graduate programs are
available in more than 50 fields, like Psychology, Health Sciences and
more.
Admissions require incoming students to begin during fall semester.
Decisions are determined based on the strength of a student’s academic
record, ACT/SAT scores, secondary school report, extracurricular
activities and personal statement.
Tuition is set lower for Virginia residents, although all students may be
eligible to receive financial aid if they complete a FAFSA by March 1.
Forms of aid include Pell grants, SEO grants, the Virginia Guaranteed
Assistance Program and more.

Description: University of San Carlos is a private Catholic university, offering 80 undergraduate and 85 graduate programs.
Headerquarters Regions: Asia-Pacific (APAC), Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), Southeast Asia
Full Description:
Founded by the Spanish Jesuits on August 1, 1595, USC was formerly known as the Colegio de San Ildefonso. In 1769, it was closed upon the expulsion of the Jesuits from the Philippines. It reopened in 1783 along Martires Street on the initiative of Bishop Mateo Joaquin de Arevalo under the name Colegio-Seminario de San Carlos, named after St. Charles Borromeo, the great patron of ecclesiastical training in the Renaissance. In 1867, the Vincentians took over the administration of San Carlos. 
One of the top universities outside Manila, the University of San Carlos enjoys an environment free from the hustle and bustle that often distracts students in the capital. But the difference stops there. As the business and tourist hub of Southern Philippines, Metro Cebu provides Carolinians (as USC students are called) with a cosmopolitan setting where malls are just a few minutes away from the beaches, heritage towns, or mountain resorts. 
With its four campuses housing all levels of educational programs that include eight colleges and 27 departments, USC is truly a “universe-city” in its own right. International linkages now External Affairs and a steady influx of foreign students and visiting professors have made USC a multicultural academic community bonded by the common pursuit for global standards. 
A mix of old and new marks USC’s brand of education. The missionary spirit is kept alive with the school’s pursuit for the latest in science, technology, and the arts. A sense of heritage blends well with the Carolinian enthusiasm for the new. And this is best shown in the increasingly eclectic look of the school’s architecture. 
In general, USC is busy getting a makeover. But as modern buildings rise in the campuses, ancient ones are carefully preserved. Thus, the newly-renovated façade of the Main Campus looks as fresh as when it rose from the rubbles of the Second World War during the University’s period of reconstruction. 
A recent campaign to name the buildings, halls, and premises after past administrators and individual patrons who contributed greatly to the University’s growth helps to give today’s Carolinians a sense of campus history. Students often wonder why most of the names are those of foreigners. Then they realize that their school has always had that international character and so gearing up for the challenges of the future, today’s global-minded Carolinian never stops to pay tribute to the past.
Founders: Antonio Pereira, Antonio Sedeno, Pedro Chirino
Contact Job Departments: Operations

Description: Haas School of Business is an American university that offers a range of business- and management-based academic programs.
Headerquarters Regions: San Francisco Bay Area, West Coast, Western US
Full Description:
Haas School of Business is an American university that offers a range of academic programs that include Master of Business Administration, Ph.D., Master of Financial Engineering, undergraduate programs, and executive education programs.  The school is one of 14 schools and colleges at the University of California, Berkeley.
The Haas School of Business offers seven areas of general management fundamentals for students to focus on. They include accounting, business, and public policy, economic analysis and public policy, finance, management of organizations, marketing, and operations and information technology management. Additionally, students can earn a certificate in one of five areas of study: global management, real estate, health management, entrepreneurship, and technology.
The school is situated in three connected buildings surrounding a central courtyard on the southeastern corner of the Berkeley campus. The school is planning to expand its facilities with a new commons building shared with the Berkeley School of Law. It is consistently ranked as one of the top ten business schools in worldwide rankings published by The Economist, Financial Times, US News & World Report, and Bloomberg Businessweek.
The Haas School of Business first established as the College of Commerce of the University of California in 1898.

Description: The Newcastle University of Science and Technology. is .,501 SilverSide Road, Ste 82, Wilmington, New Castle, 19809, Delaware USA
Full Description:
New Castle University of Science and Technology is an educational institute that offers educational services to its students.
The institute provides undergraduate and postgraduate programs to its students. Its range of courses consists of LLB, GDL, LPC, BPTC, LLM, and MSc. Furthermore, it provides courses for trainee lawyers, solicitors, and barristers.

Description: Roma Tre University is a public research university located in Rome, Italy.
Full Description:
Roma Tre University is an Italian public research university located in Rome, Italy, with its main campus situated in the Ostiense quarter.
Founded in 1992 by the Ministry of Public Education, under the request of several professors of the Sapienza University of Rome, it was the third public university to be established in the metropolitan area of Rome. The university comprises 8 schools and 32 departments, enrolling 35,338 students and having 1,370 academic and professional staff. At present, the university offers 54 undergraduate degree programs, 75 master's degree programs, 16 doctoral schools and five PhD programs. It is the second-largest university of Rome by enrollment and one of the largest research-based institutions in the country.
